bibl.title: William C.F. Martz v. J.H. Whitcourt. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Judicial District for the Territory of Washington holding terms at Kalama in Cowlitz County, for the counties of Cowlitz Wahkiakum and Pacific.
In the matter of the petition of W. F.C. Martz for a writ of Habeas Corpus
To J.H. Whitcourt Sheriff of Pacific County, Washington Territory in said Judicial District Greeting

In the of the United of America you are hereby commanded, that you have the body of William F.C. Martz by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention by whatever name said William F.C. Martz shall be called or chaged, before Hon. Roger S. Greene Judge of said District Court of the Second Judicial District Territory of Washington Territory terms at Kalama in Cowlitz County in and for the counties of Cowlitz, Wah- kiakum and Pacific on the 1st Thursday in March to wit on the 2nd day of March A.D. 1876 at the chambers of said Judge in the City of Olympia county of Thurston Washington Territory to do and receive what shall then and there be considered, concerning the said William F.C. Martz, and have you then and there this writ.
Witness Roger S. Greene Esq Judge of the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory this Eighteenth day of February A.D. 1876.
Attest my hand and the seal of said Court the day and year cost above written. Joseph C. Coughton Clerk By H.H. Holt Deputy
